title: All the happenings in the lakes area , Oct . 8 - 19
body_text:
The Detroit Lakes Tribune accepts community calendar items for publication online and, space permitting, in our Wednesday e-paper and Saturday print edition. Submissions must be made at least a week in advance of the event date, in writing, to either dltribune@dlnewspapers.com or vgerdes@dlnewspapers.com. Each submission must include the date, time and location of event, and where to go for more information (phone, email and/or website). Also include whether the event is free or paid admission, and how much it costs when applicable.
Wednesday, October 8
Phil Hansen Q & A: Join the members of the Detroit Lakes Community & Cultural Center's Engage group at the Holmes Art Cellar, 801 Oak Grove Ave., Detroit Lakes (basement level of the Holmes Theatre — direct entrance is on Oak Grove Avenue), for a 10 a.m. question-and-answer session with Becker County Commissioner Phil Hansen. Free and open to the public. If you 'd like to stay for the noon meal please call 218-847-5823 to reserve your spot.
ADVERTISEMENT
DMF Business Lunch and Learn: The Dakota Medical Foundation will host a "lunch and learn" session from 11:30 a.m.-1 p.m. at the Detroit Lakes Holiday Inn. A complimentary lunch will be provided as part of the presentation, which starts at noon. Discover how Dakota Medical Foundation’s programs like Giving Hearts Day and Lend A Hand Up create opportunities for businesses to give back, connect, and make a bigger impact in their local community. Please RSVP at dakotamedicalfoundation.ticketspice.com/detroit-lakes-business-lunch-and-learn if planning to attend.
DFL Socialize and Mobilize: Join fellow Democrats for a "socialize and mobilize" event at Bucks Mill Brewing, 824 Washington Ave., Detroit Lakes, from 5:30-7 p.m., and help mobilize voter empowerment for 2026 and beyond. There will be snacks and prizes. All are welcome. Visit mobilize.us/mobilize/event/840785 for more information.
Mixed Media Collage Class: Step into the season of remembrance and creativity with a 5 p.m. collage workshop inspired by artist Carmen McCullough's "The Book of Ancestors" and the traditions of Día de los Muertos. McCullough will help students explore basic collage techniques while creating layered works of art that honor those who came before us. Using paint, paper, glue, vintage images and found materials, you’ll learn how to cut, arrange and assemble pieces into meaningful compositions. Cost is $55 per person, and pre-registration is due by Friday, Oct. 3. This class is designed for artists age 16 and up, and class size is limited, so sign up online at dlccc.org/artcella r to reserve your spot as soon as possible.
Fire Department Open House: The Detroit Lakes Fire Department will be opening up its doors at 417 Main St. West for an open house from 5-7 p.m., with free hot dogs, chips and lemonade for all attendees along with a car extraction demonstration, "meet and greet" with Sparky the Dog, fire station tours and even a chance to spray a real fire hose! Free and open to the public; all are welcome.
Thursday, October 9
Breast Health Presentation: Join the members of the Detroit Lakes Community & Cultural Center's Engage group at the Holmes Art Cellar, 801 Oak Grove Ave., Detroit Lakes (basement level of the Holmes Theatre — direct entrance is on Oak Grove Avenue), for a 10 a.m. presentation on "Breast Health and Cancer Awareness." Free and open to the public. If you'd like to stay for the noon meal, please call 218-847-5823 to reserve your spot.
Charitable Pint Night-Lakes Figure Skating: Join members of the Lakes Figure Skating Club at Bucks Mill Brewing, 824 Washington Ave., Detroit Lakes, from 5-8 p.m. and learn more about this local member of the U.S. Figure Skating Association. A portion of the proceeds from every pint sold during the event will go to support LFSC.
Paint and Drink: Eagles Aerie 2342 will host a "Paint and Drink" event starting at 6 p.m. in the Detroit Lakes Eagles Club, 112 W. Holmes St. Please pre-register at the club in advance, as spots fill up fast. Call 218-847-5267 for more information.
ADVERTISEMENT
Wicked Plant Art Opening Reception: An opening reception for regional artist Carmen McCullough's new indoor-outdoor exhibition, "Wicked Plant Art," will take place from 5-7 p.m. at the Becker County Museum, 714 Summit Ave., Detroit Lakes. Be sure to check out the other two parts of McCullough's Detroit Lakes exhibition, at Ortenstone Gardens and Sculpture Park and Bluebird Books, which will open to the public the same day and remain on display through Jan. 15, 2026, during each venue's regular hours of operation. The exhibition is co-sponsored by the Becker County Museum and Project 412. Visit Project412mn.org/Wicked-Plant-Art for more information.
The Music of Billy Joel and Elton John: Multi-faceted pop and rock entertainer Michael Cavanaugh stars in the tribute show, "The Music of Billy Joel and Elton John," which comes to the stage of Detroit Lakes' Historic Holmes Theatre, 806 Summit Ave., for a 7:30 p.m. performance. Tickets are available at the box office, online at dlccc.org/holmes-theatre, or by phone at 218-844-7469.
Square Dancing: Join the Wadena Whirlaways at St. Michael's Catholic Church in Motley for a square dance from 7-9:30 p.m. Abe Maier is the caller, and "Hat Night" is the theme. Call 612-743-3480 for more information.
Friday, October 10
Deep Dive DL: Join Project 412 at Clarity Wine Bar in downtown Detroit Lakes for the latest installment of its "Deep Dive DL" entrepreneurship speaker series. Enjoy some coffee and socializing at 8 a.m., followed by a presentation from featured artist Linda Beilke, and a "Behind the Business Talk" with Clarity Wine Bar entrepreneur Chelsea Malstrom, followed by an audience Q&A. Free and open to the public.
Tailgating for Troops: Join United Community Bank, Frazee-Vergas Public Schools, and the Frazee FFA to support Honor Flights of North Dakota and Minnesota. Starting at 5 p.m., before the homecoming football game against the Lake Park-Audubon Raiders at 7 p.m., come enjoy a hot dog dinner, games and more, with all proceeds raised going to support the Honor Flight program — including a 100% match from UCB.
Square Dancing: The Park Rapids Friendly Squares will host a dance from 7:30-9:30 p.m. at Century School, 501 Helten Ave., Park Rapids, with Larry Fruetel calling. Potluck after the dance. Spectators are welcome. For more information contact Karen at 218-252-3853.
Live Music: Rachael Ianiro at the Sandbar II in Detroit Lakes, 6:30-9:30 p.m.; Mike Morse at Lake Park Liquors in Lake Park, 9 p.m.-midnight.
ADVERTISEMENT
Saturday, October 11
A Pavilion Celebration: Join the Becker County Museum and City of Detroit Lakes staff at the Pavilion, 1361 Washington Ave., Detroit Lakes, for an all-day celebration, 11 a.m.-11 p.m., that will open with VFW Post 1676 Bingo (relocated to the Pavilion for the celebration). The afternoon festivities will include a welcome from Mayor Matt Brenk and the Lake Region Veterans Color Guard at 2:30 p.m., "Polka and Pie" at 3 p.m., plus Family Day activities, Pavilion history displays, a community glass mosaic art project, and more, all from 3-5 pm.. At 4 p.m., the VFW's taco bar will open (along with a cash bar), and Lewy Ronken will be bringing his "Buddy Holly" tribute to the Pavilion stage, followed by performances from The 60s Guys, Romyn & Rick, Dan Brekke and 32 Below. The ticketed evening celebration starts at 5 p.m., with live music, food and drinks available until the doors close on the Pavilion's final scheduled public event. Tickets are $20 each for adults after 5 p.m., and may be purchased at the door or in advance at the museum (including its online store at beckercountyhistory.org).
Flu Shot Clinic: Sanford Health will offer flu vaccinations to all patients six months and older from 9 a.m.-12 p.m. at the Sanford Detroit Lakes Clinic, 1245 Washington Ave. Appointments are encouraged, but walk-ins are welcome. Please visit mysanfordchart.org to schedule your vaccine or call 218-846-2000 to make an appointment.
Detroit Lakes Kids and Parents Expo: The 3rd Annual Kids and Parents Expo will take place from 9 a.m.-noon in the Lakeshirts Fieldhouse at Detroit Lakes High School, 1362 Madison Ave., Detroit Lakes. There will be sweet treats, activities, entertainment and educational opportunities galore. All are welcome.
Free Family Movie: Odyssey Washington Square Theatres in Detroit Lakes will host a free screening of the family-friendly animated feature, "Hotel Transylvania," starting at 10 a.m. Doors and concessions open at 9:30 a.m. No tickets necessary as all seating is on a first-come, first-served basis. All ages welcome.
Permit to Carry Class: The Detroit Lakes School of Tae Kwon Do and Kumdo will host a Minnesota permit to carry firearms class taught by Kinetic Defense Training from 10 a.m.-2 p.m. at 1042 U.S. Hwy. 59 South, Detroit Lakes. This class will be held in person by certified NRA Defensive Pistol and MN Permit instructor Lucas Holzhueter. Learn the basics of handgun use, including hands-on training with dummy ammo, shoot-don’t-shoot scenarios and more. Cost is $80, with class essentials included; handgun rental available for an additional fee. Call or text Lucas in advance at 218-234-5890, sign up online via the Facebook event page or register in person the day of the event.
Holistic Expo: Up to 30 vendors ranging from psychics, mediums and tarot card readers to sound healers and Reiki energy workers. Crystals, CBD products and more will be at the Detroit Lakes Holiday Inn from 10 a.m.-5 p.m. for Holistic Expo 2025. The first 30 people through the door will receive a free gift bag. Tickets are $5 per person, with children under age 10 admitted free of charge. All are welcome.
Lakes Area Home Tour: Elevate will host its Lakes Area Home Tour from 10 a.m.-5 p.m., with seven homes in the Perham-Vergas-Ottertail-New York Mills area featured. Ticktets are $30 each and may be purchased in advance at Nest and Prairiegrass in Perham, Natalie's Serendipity in Vergas, Periwinkle in Ottertail and Lumber Depot in New York Mills. You can also purchase them online at elevateotc.org/home-tour.
ADVERTISEMENT
Junk Journal Class: Want to learn a new hobby? Join instructor Brenda Labine at the Detroit Lakes Public Library, 1000 Washington Ave., for a 3 p.m. class titled, "Create Your Own Junk Journal." The class will lead you through creating a handmade personal "junk journal" using recycled and repurposed materials. No cost to attend, but registration is required. Sign up online at larl.org/events or call 218-847-2168 to reserve your spot.
S'More Community Night: Bucks Mill Brewing in downtown Detroit Lakes will host its first S'More Community Night of the fall season, starting at 6:30 p.m. Come on down and enjoy some warm s'mores (fixins' provided), buy a pint of your favorite brew (alcoholic and non-alcoholic options available) and take part in the "icebreaker" question to start off the evening. All are welcome.
Live Music: Pavilion Celebration at the Detroit Lakes Pavilion will include Cathy Erickson and MaryJo, 3 p.m.; Lewy Ronken as Buddy Holly, 4 p.m.; The 60's Guys, 4:45 p.m.; Romyn & Rick, 6 p.m.; Dan Brekke at 7:15 p.m.; and 32 Below at 9 p.m. (admission is free until 5 p.m., after which tickets are $20 each). Elsewhere, Brianna and Lars perform at the Cormorant Pub Boathouse in Cormorant, 7-10 p.m..; Elijah O'Sullivan at Al's Bar and Grill/Audubon Liquor Store in Audubon, 7:30-10:30 p.m.; and Matt Aakre at The Roadhouse in Cormorant, 8-11 p.m.
Sunday, October 12
VFW Auxiliary Breakfast: Come support the local VFW Auxiliary and their veterans programs by attending their monthly breakfast fundraiser at VFW Post 1676, 500 Washington Ave., Detroit Lakes, served from 8 a.m. to noon. Menu is pancakes and sausage or biscuits and sausage gravy, with eggs and a choice of juice or coffee, all for a donation of $9 per person. All are welcome.
Holy Rosary Parish Festival: Holy Rosary Catholic Church and School of Detroit Lakes will host its annual Parish Festival. starting with Morning Mass at 11 a.m. and continuing with a sit-down dinner and afternoon activities from 12-3 p.m. Highlights include kids’ games, hot dogs and pizza, raffles, bingo, a farmers market and a quilters’ booth, culminating in the raffle prize drawings at 3 p.m. Holy Rosary Parish warmly invites all community members to attend, enjoy the festivities, and help support the parish. For more information, please contact the Holy Rosary Parish Office at 218-847-1393 or visit holyrosarycc.org.
Young Life Banquet: Lakes Area Young Life will hold its fall banquet at the Castaway Club, 51709 Co. Hwy. 31, Pelican Rapids, starting at 5:30 p.m. Hear powerful stories of what God is doing in the lives of teenagers right here in the lakes area community, while also sharing laughter and connection with friends. Heavy appetizers will be served. Call 218-218-847-3567 or send an email to lakesareayounglife@gmail.com for more information.
Tuesday, October 14
"Adventures in the Arctic" Presentation: Join the members of the Detroit Lakes Community & Cultural Center's Engage group at the Holmes Art Cellar, 801 Oak Grove Ave., Detroit Lakes (basement level of the Holmes Theatre — direct entrance is on Oak Grove Avenue), for Lin Peterson's 10 a.m. presentation on his "Arctic Adventures." Free and open to the public. If you'd like to stay for the noon meal, please call 218-847-5823 to reserve your spot.
ADVERTISEMENT
ECFE Night at the Museum: The Becker County Museum will host Detroit Lakes Early Childhood Family Education from 5:45-6:45 p.m. for some activities and opportunities to explore the museum. Open to families with infants, toddlers and preschool-age children. Sign up online at dlschools.arux.app if planning to attend.
"The Thirteenth Crime" Presentation: Minnesota author Janet Prues takes us back in time to Otter Tail County, circa 1887, as she discusses her book, "The Thirteenth Crime: The Ghosts of Injustice in Frontier Otter Tail County," during a 6 p.m. presentation at the Detroit Lakes Public Library. Delve into the true story of Lillie Field and her untimely death at the hands of another, and decide for yourself if Lillie's ghost still roams this plain, begging for her story to be told. Q&A and book signing to follow the presentation, which is free and open to the public.
Sons of Norway Anniversary/Membership Dinner: The Sons of Norway, Vikingland Lodge 1-495 of Detroit Lakes, will hold their annual membership/anniversary dinner in the lower level of First Lutheran Church, 912 Lake Ave., Detroit Lakes, starting at 6 p.m. Contact Gretchen Henrickson at 612-791-3786 for more information.
Acrylic Landscape Painting: Join instructor Val Voigt at the Holmes Art Cellar, 806 Summit Avenue, Detroit Lakes (basement of the Holmes Theatre) for a "Nightfall"-themed acrylic landscape painting class from 6-8:30 p.m. and learn how to paint an evening scene, set in the deep woods, with hints of fall in the air. You can adjust and add to your painting by adding fall/spooky details. Val will paint along with you to show techniques, color mixing, and brush strokes. Cost is $50 per person, with all supplies included, and all experience and age levels are welcome. Though aprons are provided, you may want to wear a "paint shirt" to protect your clothing. Sign up online at dlccc.org/artcellar to reserve your spot.
Friday, October 17
Baked Potato Lunch: The Boys and Girls Club of Detroit Lakes will host its annual Baked Potato Lunch benefiting the United Way of Becker County from 11:30 a.m.-1 p.m. at 150 Richwood Road, Detroit Lakes. Takeout and dine-in options are available. A free will donation of your choice will get you a baked potato and access to a buffet of different toppings. No RSVP required to dine in; those who want their orders to go can call 218-847-5700, extension 5, or send an email to pr@dlclub.org. You can also order online via the website at bgcdl.org, or the link on the Facebook event page.
Local Legends and Lore: Join members of the Midwest Paranormal Files at the Detroit Lakes Public Library for a 6 p.m. presentation on "Local Legends and Lore" and learn about local legends, cryptids, and folklore from the experts, who have been investigating the paranormal since 2010. This free presentation is family-friendly and open to the public.
Square Dancing: The Country Twirlers will host a square dance at the Detroit Lakes IOOF Hall, 118 W. Holmes St., from 7-9 p.m. Tom Allen will be the caller. Cost is $5 per person. For more information, call 218-849-9317.
ADVERTISEMENT
Live Music: Seth Moore at the Sandbar II in Detroit Lakes, 6:30-9:30 p.m.
Saturday, October 18
Detroit Lakes Amateur Radio Club: The monthly meeting of the Detroit Lakes Amateur Radio Club will take place in the Ice House Restaurant at the Detroit Lakes Holiday Inn, starting at 9 a.m. An informative presentation will conclude the gathering. Virtual meeting options are available. Visit the website at www.w0emz.org for more information.
Veterans UTV Ride: Come to the Fishbowl on Cotton Lake at 9 a.m. for the first-ever Veterans UTV Ride. which will start at 10 a.m., rain or shine. No pre-registration required; "tailgate party" specials inside The Fishbowl, located at 2-0762 Co. Road, 29, Rochert. All proceeds from the ride will benefit area veterans.
Hidden History Tour: Join members of the Midwest Paranormal Files for a spine-tingling Hidden History Tour of downtown Detroit Lakes at 7 p.m. and learn about all the true stories of murder, mystery and mayhem that have dotted the town's history. Cost is $20 per person, and your tickets must be purchased in advance. Visit the website at paranormalfiles.org/index.php/shop to reserve your spot.
"Stags and Tags" Purse Bingo and More: Join the KAOTIC Robotics team at the Frazee Event Center for an evening of purse bingo, plus a few extras, starting at 5:30 p.m. Cost is $20 per person, and tickets may be purchased online at ticketsource.com/booking/select/xpgmgmqyzqbq. Must be 18 to attend and play bingo; only cards purchased at the event will be accepted.
Charitable Pint Night-Broken Strings Guitar Club: Join members of the Broken Strings Guitar Club at Bucks Mill Brewing, 824 Washington Ave., Detroit Lakes, from 5-8 p.m. and enjoy some great local music during Bucks Mill's first open mic night session. A portion of the proceeds from every pint sold during the event will go to support this local non-profit and its efforts to donate guitars to aspiring musicians and spread the joy of music.
Live Music: Mick Klein at the Cormorant Pub Boathouse in Cormorant, 7-10 p.m.; Brianna Helbling at Al's Bar and Grill/Audubon Liquor Store in Audubon, 7:30-10:30 p.m.; Tyler Steinle (from 32 Below) at The Roadhouse in Cormorant, 8-11 p.m.; Kyle Colby at Zorbaz in Detroit Lakes, 9 p.m.-1 a.m.
Sunday, October 19
Color Guard Fundraiser Breakfast: The Lake Region Veterans Color Guard will be hosting a breakfast fundraiser from 8 a.m.-12 p.m. at the American Legion Club, 810 West Lake Drive, Detroit Lakes. Suggested minimum donation is $9 for a meal including scrambled eggs; pancakes or French toast; sausage or bacon; and coffee or orange juice. All are welcome.
Richville Breakfast: The final Sunday breakfast of 2025 at the Richville Community Center will take place from 8 a.m. to noon. Menu includes a choice of pancakes or French toast, with sausage and eggs (gluten-free toast is available). Two raffle drawings will take place during the event as well. All are welcome.
Pinball Tournament: Bucks Mill Brewing in downtown Detroit Lakes will host a pinball tournament starting at 1 p.m., with registration opening at 12:30 p.m. Entry fee is $10 per person; all skill levels welcome. Open to the public.
Cribbage Tournament: Bucks Mill Brewing in downtown Detroit Lakes will host a cribbage tournament starting at 1 p.m., with registration opening at 12:30 p.m. Entry fee is $10 per person. Format is a 3-game-guarantee bracket, with cash and gift card prizes awarded to the top three finishers. All are welcome.
ULTRA Membership Drive: Interested in joining the ULTRA Snowmobile Club? Then come to Al's Bar and Grill/Audubon Liquor Store in Audubon at 1 p.m. for a meet-and-greet, lunch and membership drive. Those who do enroll can enjoy a free lunch on the club. Open to the public.
Multi-day and Recurring Events
Break the Silence Memorial Display: The Detroit Lakes City Park will host a "Break the Silence Memorial Display" from Oct. 1-15 — the first two weeks of Domestic Violence Awareness Month. The fourth annual display, sponsored by the Lakes Crisis and Resource Center of Detroit Lakes, is a series of 32 silhouettes that serve as a virtual representation of Minnesota's victims of intimate partner homicide, with each representing someone's child, parent, sibling, husband, wife, partner, friend, neighbor or coworker. Come to the Detroit Lakes City Park to learn about, remember, and honor each victim. There will be event booklets available at the park as well as at LCRC's offices on Pelican Lane, and each silhouette will also have a QR code that you can scan with your smartphone to obtain more in-depth information on each victim. You can also visit the website at lakescrisis.com/display for the full list of names and stories included in each year's display, dating back to 2022-23.
Cormorant MEA Day Camp: Kids ages 6-12 are invited to bring their parents and enjoy MEA Day Camp at Camp Cormorant, 9 a.m.-4 p.m. on both Friday and Saturday, Oct. 16-17. Activities will include the rock wall, nature hikes, crafts, field games, and more. Come for one or both of the days. Cost is $40 per member or $50 for non-members.
CornerStone Haunted Forest: The Cornerstone Youth and Community Center in Frazee is preparing to host its third annual Haunted Forest event on Saturday and Sunday, Oct. 17-18, with "first scare" at 6:30 p.m. each night and the last group admitted at 10:30 p.m. Cost is $15 per person; the Haunted Forest is located at 35646 154th St., Frazee. Call 218-329-6199 for more information.
Walk-In Flu Shot Clinics: Essentia Health is offering convenient walk-in flu shot clinics to help protect yourself and loved ones this respiratory season. Clinics are open through Nov. 26 at the following locations and times: Essentia Health Urgent Care-Detroit Lakes, 4:30-7:30 p.m. Wednesdays and Thursdays; and Essentia Health St. Mary's-Frazee Clinic, 8 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. Thursdays. Flu vaccines are intended for people 6 months of age and older, and are covered by Medicare, Medicaid and most commercial and private insurance plans. Remember to wear short sleeves for easy administration. You do not need to be an Essentia patient to attend, but if you are, you can schedule your flu shot through your Essentia MyChart account. Others can go online to EssentiaHealth.org/flu or call the toll-free number at 844-663-1068.
Lakes Area Farmers Market: The Lakes Area Farmers Market will be open every Saturday in October (weather permitting) at Detroit Lakes' Peoples Park from 10 a.m.-1 p.m. Besides fresh produce when available, local vendors will be offering fresh-baked bread and other baked goods, handcrafted candies and more. Visit lakesareafarmersmarket.info, call 218-230-9822 or visit their Facebook page for more information.
Pressure Canner Gauge Testing: The University of Minnesota Extension Service in Becker County is equipped to test pressure canner dial gauges for home canners, using a pump dial gauge-testing unit. This unit uses air rather than steam pressure to test pressure canner gauges. Please call Linda Perrine, Extension Office Manager at 218-846-7328 to make an appointment to have your gauge tested free of charge. The Extension Office is located at 1120 8th St. SE, Detroit Lakes. For general home canning questions, contact the University of Minnesota AnswerLine toll-free at 1-800-854-1678. Calls are answered Monday-Friday between 9 a.m.-noon and 1-4 p.m.
Grace Cafe: Grace Lutheran Church in Detroit Lakes will be serving lunch every Wednesday from 11 a.m.-1 p.m. Menu varies from week to week. The lunch is open to all in the Detroit Lakes area; admission is a free-will donation.
Grace Food Pantry: Grace Lutheran Church in Detroit Lakes will be operating a food pantry during its regular office hours, 9 a.m.- noon, Monday through Friday. Anyone in need can come in and pick up some food. Donations will also be accepted.
Becker County Food Pantry: Open to the public on Tuesdays and Thursdays from 12-3 p.m. at 610 Terry Street, Detroit Lakes. Call 218-846-0142 for more information.
Music Video Bingo: Come to The Roadhouse in Cormorant every Friday night for some Music Video Bingo from 8-10 p.m., followed by karaoke. Free to play; all are welcome.
Coffee Chats: Join the Big DL Business Collective at La Barista in downtown Detroit Lakes, every Friday from 8-10 a.m. for a casual get-together with other local business owners, entrepreneurs, and community leaders. Whether you can stay for 10 minutes or the full two hours, you’re welcome to grab a cup of coffee and join the conversation. No agenda, no pressure, just good coffee, good company, and a chance to meet, catch up, and build valuable connections in a relaxed atmosphere. This event is free and open to everyone, but be sure to support our gracious hosts by purchasing your favorite coffee or treat!
GED/Adult Diploma Instruction: If one of your “life happens” moments resulted in not finishing high school, Lakes Area Adult Education is ready to help you complete that process with a GED or an Adult Diploma. Orientation sessions take place twice a month, so get in touch and get started now! Call 218-844-5760 or email slandsem@detlakes.k12.mn.us. Please note that the Adult Education office at M State has been moved to Room F-114 (use the east side entrance).
Free ESL Instruction: Free English as a Second Language instruction for adults is offered at Lakes Area Adult Education. The schedule is flexible and individualized. Call 218-844-5760 or email slandsem@detlakes.k12.mn.us for more information. Please note that the Adult Education office at M State has been moved to Room F-114 (use the east side entrance).
Food Production Manager Certification: Lakes Area Adult Education offers SERVSAFE classes twice a year for those needing state-certified food protection manager certification or re-certification; additional classes may be scheduled to fit your needs (for six or more participants). Call 218-844-5760 or email slandsem@detlakes.k12.mn.us for more information.
Driver's License Written Exam Prep: Lakes Area Adult Education offers virtual classes for the Minnesota Driver's License written exam preparation every fall and spring. These classes help unlicensed adult drivers to become familiar with vocabulary, signs, and rules of the road that will assist them in passing the written portion of the MN Driver’s License Exam. Call 218-844-5760 or email slandsem@detlakes.k12.mn.us for more information.
TOPS Meeting: The local chapter of Take Off Pounds Sensibly (TOPS) meets weekly on Thursday mornings at Trinity Lutheran Church, 1401 Madison Ave., Detroit Lakes. Weigh-in begins at 8:20 a.m., meeting at 9 a.m. Contact Carol at 218-841-0226 or Coleen at 218-841-2877 for more information. All are welcome; first session is free.
Library Storytime: The Detroit Lakes Public Library offers weekly Preschool Storytime sessions every Thursday at 10:30 a.m. Preschoolers and their caregivers/families are invited to join library staff for stories, flannel boards, finger plays, songs and more. This early literacy experience explores a different theme each week and is a way to encourage young children to enjoy reading. Call 218-847-2168 for more information.
Celebrate Recovery: The Celebrate Recovery group meets every Tuesday, 6:30-8 p.m. at Christian Fellowship Church, 28048 Meadow Drive, Detroit Lakes, to take the next steps on the "Road to Recovery: Eight Principles Based on the Beatitudes, Twelve Steps and their Biblical Comparison." Many struggle with alcoholism, divorce, sexual abuse, codependency, domestic violence, drug addiction, food and gambling addictions. Celebrate Recovery is a tried and proven format to help you walk through life's struggles. Men and women meet in a large group format, then break off into smaller discussion groups; men with men, women with women. Come as you are. No cost. We are here to help. Unfortunately, no childcare is available at this time. For more information, check out the website at celebraterecovery.com or call us at 218-234-2496.
Caring Cup Grief Support: The Caring Cup, a gathering of community members who are dealing with the loss of a loved one, will meet at the David-Donehower Funeral Home in Detroit Lakes on the second Wednesday of every month; the Furey Funeral Home in Frazee on every third Wednesday, and West-Kjos Funeral Home in Detroit Lakes on every fourth Wednesday. All meetings take place from 10:30 to 11:30 a.m. and offer a relaxed time to face the challenges of life after loss, together. For more information, call Mary Swenson at 218-847-4147.
Coffee Club: David-Donehower Funeral Home hosts a monthly Coffee Club in the community room at the Detroit Lakes Police Department (106 E. Holmes St.) on the third Tuesday of every month, starting at 10 a.m. Learn how intentional planning of your final wishes and setting funds aside today, will protect your loved ones in the future. Anna Schmitz from Edward Jones will also lead a relaxed, informal discussion on current events, the economy and investing. Plus, the coffee's on us! Free and open to the public.
Trivia Nights: Detroit Lakes' Lakeside Tavern hosts a Trivia Night every Monday from 7 to 9 p.m. in its upstairs space; and both Bucks Mill Brewing and the Holiday Inn host Trivia Mafia every Wednesday night, starting at 6 p.m. in the Holiday Inn and 7 p.m. at Bucks Mill. Lakeside is located at 200 West Lake Drive, while Bucks Mill Brewing is located at 824 Washington Ave. in downtown Detroit Lakes and the Holiday Inn is at 1155 U.S. Hwy. 10, Detroit Lakes.
Tinker Tots: Parents with kids between the ages of 1-5 are invited to bring them to the Becker County Museum, 714 Summit Ave., Detroit Lakes, from 10 a.m.-1 p.m. every Thursday for a STEAM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Arts and Math)-themed activity designed just for them. Though there is no cost for the event, regular museum admission applies (free for museum members; $10 adults, $5 kids age 1 and up for nonmembers).
Community Chess Club: The Becker County Museum will once again be hosting a Chess Club every Tuesday evening from 5-7 p.m. All experience levels welcome, from first-time players to seasoned strategists. Different focus topics each week to keep your game sharp and interesting, in a relaxed, fun environment where you can learn, play, and share your love of chess — whether you want to challenge yourself, learn something new, or just have fun.
Cribbage Players Wanted: The Richville Community Center will host open cribbage play on Thursdays from 1-3 p.m. Both new and experienced players are welcome. Can play two-hand, three-hand and four-hand. Cost is $2 per person; there will be prize money. The community center is located at 100 Grove St. SW in Richville. Call Carolyn at 218-758-2162 if interested in joining, or for more information.
Heart O'Lakes Harmony: The Heart O'Lakes Harmony men's barbershop-style a cappella choral group is looking for new members. Anyone who enjoys singing is welcome to come join their weekly practices, every Monday at 7 p.m. in Faith Lutheran Church, 423 S. Broadway, Pelican Rapids (located across the street from the high school). For more information, please contact Harlan Hoff at 701-306-8976.
DL Cloggers: The DL Cloggers meet to dance and socialize every Tuesday (excluding holidays) at 1 p.m. in the basement of Detroit Lakes VFW Post 1676. No prior dance experience is necessary. For more information, call Ruby at 218-847-7741.
HR Connect: The Detroit Lakes Chamber is hosting an opportunity for human resources professionals, business owners and managers to connect, every first Thursday of the month at 8:15 a.m. at the Chamber office at 700 Summit Ave. Discuss human resource topics, share best practices and review data to help attract, retain and grow the workforce for the lakes region. The event is free for Chamber members, $10 for non-members.
Baby Bounce: Songs, stories, and action poems for infants, toddlers and their caregivers are offered every Monday at the Detroit Lakes Public Library at 10:30 a.m. The program runs about a half-hour, including playtime and chatting with other caregivers. For ages 0-18 months. Call 218-847-2168 for more information.
Alcoholics Anonymous: Detroit Lakes' Alano Club meets at 827 Summit Ave. on the following days and times: Sundays at 1 p.m., 12x12 open meeting; Tuesdays at 7 p.m., Big Book open meeting; Wednesdays at noon, Grapevine open meeting; Wednesdays at 6 p.m., women's open meeting; Thursdays at 7 p.m., Intro to AA open meeting; Saturdays at 7 a.m., men's open meeting; Saturdays at 9 a.m., Women's Big Book closed meeting; Saturdays at 8 p.m., open topic meeting. There are no dues or fees for meetings. For more information, call 218-844-9970 or the District 3 AA Helpline at 877-833-2327.
Holy Rosary Al-Anon Meeting: There will be an Al-Anon meeting every Thursday, starting at noon, inside Holy Rosary Catholic Church, 1043 Lake Ave., Detroit Lakes. There is also an Al-Anon meeting at 7 p.m. every Tuesday at the Alano Club at 827 Summit Ave. in Detroit Lakes.
Overeaters Anonymous: A 12-step program for those who struggle in their relationship with food, Overeaters Anonymous continues to meet at noon every Tuesday at Holy Rosary Catholic Church in Detroit Lakes. There is no charge to attend. Contact Debbie C. at 218-234-3071. Another group also meets on Sunday nights at 6 p.m. via Zoom. This is a change of venue as of Oct. 9. Please call Sharon R. at 1-701-388-7585 or Hailee S. at 1-701-212-7904 for information if you plan to join the Zoom meeting. There is no charge to participate.
